data.title: Overpriced Dried Out BBQ
data.text: The BBQ guy needs to go! The meat is so dry!! Almost like eating beef jerky. This place is more for the old retired breakfast crowd not for the BBQ enthusiast. Really wish they'd fork out the money and change but there stuck in the 60's(check out the decor of the restaurant).

data.title: Best Ribs ever!!!
data.text: My husband and I eat out allot. We have come to Emil Villas for many years and never have we been disappointed. The quality of the food is surpassed by none. It is pricy but we do not mind because of the quality.

data.title: Great BBQ and Breakfasts
data.text: This restaurant has been in the same location since the 50"s and the food and decor are probably not much different from the earlier years.  The interior looks like an old fashioned diner with counter seating and booths..  First impression may be that it is shabby and that it could probably use some fresh paint and a little sprucing up, but it is an authentic look for this restaurant.  The specialty is bar-b-que served in huge portions.  The ribs are delicious.  The standard brown sauce is pretty bland, but you can also get a spicier red version.  Great pies for dessert or take-out.  Had breakfast on previous visits.  That may best the best and most popular meals here.  Not a choice for fancy dining, but a great choice for good food in a simple setting.

data.title: Great sandwiches!
data.text: I went a couple of times since I was staying at a hotel nearby for a business trip. Tried both the BBQ pork sandwich and the Philly cheesesteak. Both were absolutely delicious! Loved the Cole slaw as a side to the BBQ and would recommend something other than the potato salad as a side unless you really love mayonnaise. Also had the strawberry pie which was absolutely outstanding! Would highly recommend this restaurant for their sandwiches!

data.title: Not shabby
data.text: This is just my opinion especially since everyone has different taste. The atmosphere was clean and had an old fashion diner look to it kinda warm inside for my taste. Server was very prompt and nice not much of a conversation starter but was good for me. I ordered the sausage and triple cheese omelette and it had ok flavor had to add some pepper an salt, it came with a biscuit which was very soft and looked homemade and came out pretty good. The sausage gravy was a little watery for my taste but like I said its only my opinion. I wouldn't mind telling people to try it. I will come back if I would be in the area again.

data.title: Great Breakfast
data.text: I had the mushroom and pepper jack cheese omelette and French dip sandwich both done to perfection the waitress are friendly and do their best to keep your drinks filled to the brim. The place itself looks a little out dated. Parking is the worst I can say of the place. I've only have ate there only for breakfast. My grandson raves about the linguicia omelette. It's reasonably priced and the portions are large.

data.title: Excellent BBQ
data.text: Emil Villa's are scattered around the East Bay feeding the smoked BBQ needs of generations of Southern and other immigrants,  servings are gigantic and seating is scarce; take your sandwich or combo plate to the curb or to a park,  Grab plenty of napkins.

data.title: Old fashioned diner/dive
data.text: Nice staff. The decor left something to be desired. The food that I ordered wasn't great. I wouldn't visit again but I am a very picky diner.

data.title: Old Scool Eats
data.text: This location is one of a chain of places and offers good food; we like the San Leandro spot better.  Breakfast is the only meal we've had here and we've been in a few times.  It's very traditional looking and the menu offers good variety.

data.title: Birthday
data.text:
Today is my birthday. I'm sixty years old.
The Hickory Pit is my choice for tonight's dinner..
I've loved this place for more than 35 years!

data.title: Best Ribs ever
data.text: This place has a long history of making the best ribs you can find. Their coleslaw is also the best I have had, and I am not a fan of coleslaw. Need a pie? The homemade pies are exceptional. Dine in or take it home and feast.

data.title: Great BBQ
data.text: Generous portions of great food. Staff was friendly and helpful. Fun place to fill those BBQ cravings.

data.title: A family type diner
data.text: A decent meal.  Sort of a family diner.  Food was good, nothing to write home about.  Service was good and price is fair

data.title: Save your money vote with your dollars
data.text: Go somewhere that appreciates your patronage. Been dining here for years and it's the worst service I've ever experienced and the prices havE gone through the roof

data.title: Basic BBQ
data.text: This is a older diner, advertising Barbecue and offering American cuisine. With thoughts of a BBQ sandwich in mind - much like I get when I'm in parts of VA and NC -I took a seat on a swivel stool at the lunch counter and asked the friendly waitress about the BBQ sandwich.  She explained that the pork is sliced and sauce is on the side. Slightly disappointed but hungry, I decided to give it a try. While waiting, I casually scanned the other occupants, interior design and decor. I observed the cook preparing my sandwich in the kitchen, which was open and on the other side of the lunch counter. Sure enough, just like the waitress said, he was slicing away on a pork loin. I saw him take a couple slices of sourdough bread, toasted them, and set several quarter inch cuts of tender loin on the bread. The coleslaw was added to the top layer of meat, not on the side, per my request, and a dill pickle spear garnished the plate.  The waitress set my California-style Poor Boy before me along with a side of baked beans and a side of sauce. I took a spoon and dribbled sauce on the meat before each bite. Wondering if the sauce was made from scratch in the restaurant, I asked the waitress and she said it came from a vendor; it might have been Sweet Baby Ray's. The beans were hot and tangy, but I suspect they, too, are a name brand. It was a delicious lunch, but a little pricey - $13 (before tip).  I think that for a place that boasts of BBQ, it falls flat. And appearance wise, it could use some modernizing and better lighting.  I probably won't come here again.

data.title: great place for breakfast
data.text:
3 of us went here for breakfast and it was outstanding---one person had pork chop and eggs and reported that it was the best ever pork chop, another person had eggs benedict and said it was awesome  and I had the chicken fried steak with eggs over easy and it was great

this is a great place for breakfast--it is fast and very good----I understand that the owner buys fruit and cuts it up as opposed to buying it cut up   one person had as side and said it was outstanding

data.title: Not what we expected won't be eating here again!!
data.text: My husband and I went to Emil Villa's to enjoy a good old fashion BBQ, and were very disappointed.We both order Emil Bar-B-Q Rib dinner. The portion was big, it came with cup of corn, French fries, a bread roll, and a cup of baked beans. The beans were lil tart, the bread roll was over microwaved and kinda hard, the corn had an unusual taste of stale, we sent back the corn and they replace with cole slaw that was dry and had horse radish drizzled on top , well that tasted just as bad so we left it alone. The chicken had no flavor or spices and it was very dry, we could taste the lighter fluid on the ribs and they were also tasteless and hard. Over all it was a waste of time and money as it was kinda pricey, but we politely thanked the waitress for her being courteous she even gave us a slice of apple pie (crust was orange and apple slices were green) cause she felt bad about the dinner, We did tell her that it was the worst bbq dinner we have ever paid for, and that we would not be back and thanked her for her patience. We took a doggie bag for all the food and thats exactly were it went to the doggies, We strongly do not recommend this restaurant.

data.title: Good food. Run down location
data.text: Food is good, used to cater parties. You can smell the goodness as you approach. But, restaurant needs a remodel, booths often have repair needs, but for us locals it can often have lines awaiting service.

data.title: Local greasy spoon.  I eat here often for weekend breakfast/brunch.
data.text:
Solid diner with decent service.  Most of the kitchen and waitstaff have been there as long as I've lived in the area (4 years).

Nice bar at the kitchen (at the rail, not a liquor bar), my preferred place to sit.

Some of the cooks there are truly impressive -- the sheer volume of orders they can juggle is staggering and impressive.

Food is generally great with a wide selection on the menu.  Omelettes are particularly good.

Parking is easy (good sized lot + easy street parking behind).

data.title: Good for the price
data.text:
Convenient location.  It looks better in the pictures though.  We needed two rooms and the front desk guy upgraded our second room at no extra cost.  The beds were very comfortable but the pillows are much too thick.  

Nice pool.  Breakfast was good with a very attentive worker. The hotel could be cleaner,  but was acceptable for the price.  
Several fast food options nearby.  No elevator!!! ??? Fine for young people,  terrible for older travelers.
